abstract: A new home charger from the electric-vehicle manufacturer will adapt to, but not conform out of the box, to SAE J1772, the prevailing plug and charger standard for E.V.'s in America and Europe.
snippet: A new home charger from the electric-vehicle manufacturer will adapt to, but not conform out of the box, to SAE J1772, the prevailing plug and charger standard for E.V.'s in America and Europe.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, Calif. - Nobody would accuse Tesla Motors, the electric-vehicle manufacturer, of being a conventional company. Its nonconformist tendencies are showing again as it builds charging solutions for the Model S, the sedan expected to go on sale in mid-2012.

headline.main: Bucking Trends, Tesla Goes It Alone on Plug Design
